subtitles.text: Here we go!

and Sakura Ishiyama from JuiceJuice.
This show is about the behind-the-scenes of the production of various artists
We're going to take you behind the scenes of the production of various artists belonging to the Upfront Group.
Our recording, rehearsal, etc.

Now then, let's start with a behind-the-scenes look at the two MCs.
I've been spending a lot of time at home lately, doing personal work.

I try to get outside and walk about 10,000 steps a day.

Yes, I can really do everything I want to do at the birthday event.
What kind of costume I want to wear, what kind of song I want to sing, what kind of song I want to start, what kind of corner I want to do, etc.
I can decide what songs I want to sing, what kind of songs I want to start, what kind of corners I want to do, and so on.
You can make really great memories every year.

I've loved it since I was a teenager.

I've always wanted to sing it, and I've been keeping it warm.

Say hello
Say hello was my first original song as a trainee
It was the first original song I recorded as a trainee, and I may have participated in the recording of other songs as well, but it was the first time I received a solo part for an original song.
So Say Hello was the first time I was given a solo part in a CD.
I chose this song because I had a lot of memories of this song, including the praise I received from my seniors when I sang it at a Halo Project concert.
When I used to sing this song as a trainee, we basically sang almost in unison, so I didn't really put my feelings into it, but I didn't have time to do so.
I didn't have time to put my true feelings into it.
I sang by following the rules that were set by everyone, like "I can't say it out loud".
But when I sing all by myself, I can sing so freely, and it's so much fun, and it's a different kind of fun.
I didn't think I would become someone who liked this kind of funk groove so much 10 years ago.
So at that time
I was just happy to get a solo part, but this song is a bit like my current taste in music.
I think it's a great song and it's the first time I got a solo part.
There are so many great songs in Hello Project, and I'm going to graduate from Hello Project from now on.
Hello Project is full of great songs, and I'm graduating from Hello Project.

In this issue of APKAMI, we will go behind the scenes of the production of various artists belonging to the UPFRONT GROUP.
Please subscribe to our channel so that we can introduce you to what you don't normally see!
This time, I'll be talking with Risa Irie of JuiceJuice and
and Sakura Ishiyama of JuiceJuice.
Good bye.
Next time on Apkami, we have Subiki Factory, Freedom Dance Lesson if you only have fantasies!
And we will be showing a makeup lesson of Anna members from Ochanoma!
Enjoy!
